alert.note: Alert for Casey; Marion; Taylor (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:54PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion, northeastern Taylor and northwestern Casey Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 253 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Campbellsville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Marion, northeastern Taylor and northwestern Casey Counties, including the following locations... Taylor County Airport, Bass, Spurlington, Arista, Jacktown, Saloma, Merrimac, Hobson, Mannsville and Wooleyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
